definition: common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze

sentences.english: This was the boundary between settled and wild areas.
sentences.chinese: 这是被征服地和蛮夷之地的边界。

sentences.english: " China is "the world" center of civilization, there is no need to learn from living overseas.
sentences.chinese: 华夏是“天下”的文明中心，无须向蛮夷学习。

sentences.english: In ancient times, the Great Wall fortified China against barbarian invasions.
sentences.chinese: 古时候，长城保卫着中国，使之免遭蛮夷的入侵。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, relations of the Qin with the "Man Yi"(Barbarian) are reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 同时探讨了“秦人”与比邻“蛮夷”的关系。

sentences.english: The barbarian defiled the church by use it as stable.
sentences.chinese: 蛮夷人把教堂当作畜牲圈，使其受到玷污。

sentences.english: The ancestors of the zhou dynasty, and the north of ManYi have close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 周朝的祖先，也和北方的蛮夷有密切的关系。

sentences.english: That is how Dr. King led this country through the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 同样也正是这样，金牧师引领我们的国家走出了蛮夷。

sentences.english: Yuzhou in Song Dynasty was in the environment full of minorities, in which conflicts among different nationalities seldom stopped.
sentences.chinese: 宋代的渝州处于蛮夷环绕之下，民族冲突与斗争不断。

definition: non-Han tribes in the east and north of ancient China/barbarians
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
former southernmost province of the Chinese Empire, now northern Vietnam
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
Han Chinese name for an ancient Central Asia country
Celestial Empire, tributary title conferred on imperial China/Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
